title: Kostas Pavlidis - The Wandering (2000) (Greek Music)
description:
LINER NOTES

Kostas Pavlidis 'The most delicate gypsy voice I've ever heard' a critic said. 'I'm glad that I'm a Gypsy' Kostas Pavlidis has said.
His ROM descent has fully affected his artistic career. Started singing at ten trying to earn his living within the Gypsy community of Greece.
When was aged fifteen (15) appeared in the thematic movie 'ROM' (1st Prize at the Movie Festival of Salonica - the most important movie event of the Balkan Peninsula) directed by Menelaos Karamagiolis.
His third album "The Wandering" includes previously unreleased songs of Kostas and some of his great moments as well as fragments of live performances.
The unique vocal interpretation and the rom influence of the artist, here, meet the sounds of the East and the traditional & folk education of the soloists. 

 
http://i.imgur.com/mwU43Mx.jpg


01. Jastar Amenge Dur    [6:02]
02. Rom & Balamo    [11:00]
03. The Rom Of The Wind    [4:18]
04. The Rom Of The Land    [4:09]
05. The Rom Of The Fire    [4:01]

08. Partridge-Breasted Gypsy Woman    [3:41]
09. Arabesk    [4:22]
10. Good Luck (Live)    [4:11]
11. I Am The Gypsy, The One Who Tames    [2:17]
12. Rom (Live)    [3:16]
13. Prophecy    [2:54]



Pecussion: Al. Boulgourtzis (track 2)
Vocals: Chrysoula Christopoulou (tracks 7, 12)

Concept & Compiled By Kostas Alayannis
